This report gets its prices from Elektron, Refinitiv’s strategic data source for pricing data. Elektron is also the data source for the existing Price History and Single Price History reports. Using the same content source ensures that prices output in extractions are consistent across all three reports. The Elektron End of Day Pricing report mirrors the legacy End of Day Pricing report and offers the same content available in the Price History and Single Price History reports.

Retrieve Refinitiv evaluated premium prices. Premium prices are available for fixed income instruments in the EMEA, Asia and US regions. Multiple pricing cycles for each region are available. Premium Pricing extractions can be scheduled to execute at a scheduled time or as a result of data availability.

Retrieve Refinitiv validated premium end of day prices. Validated Premium EOD Prices are snapshot at optimal retrieve times to ensure the delivery of the “best” official close prices for global equity, futures & options, money/foreign exchange and fixed income instruments. Premium EOD Pricing extractions can be scheduled to execute at a scheduled time or as a result of data availability.

Extract pricing, reference and corporate actions data from a single report template. 

This report combines fields from the End of Day Pricing and Terms and Conditions reports, as well as certain key Corporate Actions fields and report-specific fields for extraction.

Note:  You can only extract data from the Composite report template if you are permissioned for the relevant underlying report templates. All other fields are considered Prohibited.

The Composite report provides access to End of Day Pricing and Terms and Conditions extraction fields. Corporate Actions – Voting Rights and Dividends, and Capital Change.


- Fields that appear in both the EOD Pricing and Terms and Conditions reports are available for all asset types applicable to EOD Pricing reports and follow EOD Pricing field permissioning rules. 

- Available for all asset classes currently supported for the EOD Pricing, Terms and Conditions and Corporate Actions report templates, excluding benchmarks and open access instruments.

- Supported Corporate Actions events include the following Voting Rights fields: Voting Rights Date, Voting Rights Description, Dividends, and Voting Rights Per Share. Capital Change fields include: Rights ISIN, Rights Period End Date and Rights Period Start Date. The most recent event data are returned only. Range and delta queries are not supported currently.

- Usage is reported at the field level. EOD Pricing and Corporate Actions fields are reported as regular extraction usage, and Terms and Conditions fields are reported as rental usage.

Note that as of the DataScope Select 16.1 release, new fields will no longer be added to the Composite report template. They instead will be added to the underlying report template only.

Provides Generic and MACE Schedules data for Global Government/Corporate and US Municipal bonds.

For coupon schedules, you can retrieve past, present and future coupon rates, rate changes and associated dates for government/corporate and CMO/ABS instruments.
Extract complete factor histories for CMO tranches.

Retrieve one or more fund allocation schemes, including asset, country, currency, debtor domicile, top 10 holdings, full holdings, holdings with ratings, investment country, maturity and sector for Lipper Fund instruments.
Extract complete factor histories for MBS instruments.

Provides current global institutional holdings data on 13F institutions, mutual, pension and insurance funds, declarable stake holders and U.K. share registers that can be used to identify security holdings and possessions.
